website_summaries.verdict: It won't run Photoshop or play games, but add a Bluetooth keyboard and mouse and the Asus Chromebit turns any HDMI-compatible display or television into a Web-surfing station.
pros: The Asus Chromebit is a small micro-desktop that brings cloud-based tools and services to any display at a very low price
cons: It's limited to the same online tools as other Chrome OS devices
A single USB port makes expansion difficult

website_summaries.verdict: The Asus Chromebit is a Chrome OS-based device that's no bigger than a USB flash drive. At less than $90, it turns an HDMI-equipped HDTV or monitor into a large-screen, all-in-one desktop PC.
pros: Simple to set up and use
Same size as a large USB stick
Plugs directly into an HDMI port in a monitor or HDTV
cons: Only 16GB of local storage and 2GB of RAM
Requires bundled HDMI extension cable in tight quarters

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. No Chrome suppot.
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased 2 of these. They work fine, but just received a notice that the end of life support for this from Google is November 2020. Was hoping to get more than 6 months use out of it before the feature and security updates stop.
customer_reviews.author: James Ball

customer_reviews.title: Chrome OS on this expires in Nov2020
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this new from Amazon a couple of days ago so I could set up an old tv for my kid to remote learn on, and as it turns out it will be useless before the first quarter ends. Apparantly Chrome devices expire, meaning they stop updating and thereby become useless. . THis is like buying a gallong of milk that you will never be able to finish because it will expire before you even pop the seal. I'm so dissapointed. I otherwise think this would've been a great product for remote learning.
customer_reviews.author: serafina

customer_reviews.title: Beware:  End of Life on Updates Nov 2020
customer_reviews.text: This unit will NO LONGER GET Chrome updates after Nov 2020 - it part of Google's normal EOL policy. ASUS plainly calls this out on its website, but I don't see any mention of it here
customer_reviews.author: LameGenericName

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great for 6 Months, now Freezes Up All The Time and Have to Reboot
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first, but continually freezes up now and I have to unplug Chromebit to reboot. It's not even a year old. Happens several times per day. Essentially not usable at this point. Have tried customer support, but I've not had any luck resolving the issue. Can't recommend this device...waste of money. I've reset and power washed on multiple occasions, which does not correct the problem. Probably will just throw it away. I wanted to get the Chromebox 3, but I'm hesitant to buy any ASUS chrome OS product due to the issues and lack of support I've experienced here. Moving onto another solution. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent computer
customer_reviews.text: I say excellent computer because it is essentially a PC but size wise its a thumb drive, which is great! 1- it is very reasonably priced 2- Very easy to use 3- It does not crash nor slows down 4- No installation required 5- It is safe so it does not need all that redundant anti virus software. ( automatic updates so you dont have to do anything) 6- It relies on cloud computing. So you dont have to worry about storing stuff locally I have been using for several months. Its performance is EXCELLENT.
customer_reviews.author: Steve O

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: I'm using the device at my job and I'm just loving it. I work in a school district and most of the students have Chromebooks that they are using. I use this connect to my overhead projector and now they see the same thing on my projector screen as they do on their Chromebooks. The device is easy to use and so far I haven't had any problems. Like all computers I turn off the device when I leave my classroom at the end of the day so that it doesn't get overheated. So far I have not experienced any overheating problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Struggles with high-def video playback
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Chromebit to plug into a TV, particularly for YouTube and other online video sources. The video playback consistently buffers badly for videos at 1080p 60fps, to the extent that the device is not really usable at that video resolution. For comparison, a higher-spec Chromebook on the same WiFi network has no difficulty playing the same videos smoothly, so it seems to be the Chromebit and not the network that is failing. 720p 60fps video occasionally also stutters, although not as badly. This is disappointing if you want to use this for viewing online video. For other online media viewing tasks it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Resident

customer_reviews.title: Can't stream Netflix
customer_reviews.text: We bought this thing for 1 reason: to stream web videos (Netflix, HBO Now, Amazon Prime, Hulu, Toutube, etc). Unfortunately it doesn't seem to have the horsepower to accomplish this. We only tried a few of these services, but the video playback was jumpy, as though the video decoder were stalling due to an under-powered processor. I'm pretty disappointed as this seemed to have potential to be a great little quasi-PC.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not the size of usb drive, works good for netflix
customer_reviews.text: Like this concept. I plan on using this for Netflix and Hulu only. Really wish a separate cord wasn’t necessary to power the device or even if it was powered by a micro USB port rather than a very particular circular charging port. Also I’ve noticed many of these brands claim these compute sticks are no bigger than a usb drive.. simply not true they are 2-3 times the size of a usb drive
customer_reviews.author: Big tipper

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY does NOT RUN ANY ANDROID APPS
customer_reviews.text: Today is the year 2019...ALL CHROMEBOOKS should now run Android Apps. This unit will NOT run any Android apps....does NOT have access to the Google Play Store. The model was listed on another site as to getting the upgrade to run Android Apps..but that was over 2 years ago. NO MENTION OF THAT on AMAZONs Web SITE.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. Capen

customer_reviews.title: Quite an awesome deal really...
customer_reviews.text: I use this twice a week for my youth group... where i stream music videos, present slides and embed video from youtube without a single issue. Plus since its Android, anything i change with my presentation on my chromebook and phone, it updates instantly. Only drawback ive noticed is it doesnt seem to work on older tv screens, so it wont be as versatile as i thought, but having old crap is hardly the chrome sticks fault...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plays Netflix etc. after software upgrade
customer_reviews.text: When I first starting using the ASUS CHROMEBIT CS10 Stick-Desktop PC with RockChip 3288-C 2 GB LPDDR3L 16 GB eMMC Google Chrome It seemed a little slow but picked up speed after a day or two. I noticed that it ran an older version of Chrome but after the newer version of Chrome updated I have no problems playing Netflix, Amazon Prime, and Hulu. Definitely worth the $85 Dollars!
customer_reviews.author: R. D. Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Good but several issues
customer_reviews.text: I've experienced some issues with color of playback via browser & other apps (Netflix, etc) on the device. Colors are oversaturated and imbalanced (too high contrast) compared to my Sony smart DVD player or HDMI input on my TV (Sceptre 52"). Also pairing with an Anker bluetooth keyboard & Logitech bluetooth mouse has been much more fidgety than I expected. Honestly kinda disappointed with the product. Was hoping it would have better fidelity for TV playback of MP4 movies from a USB drive.
customer_reviews.author: fields

customer_reviews.title: Does everything a low-end Chromebook should do as well as you could hope.
customer_reviews.text: My school district provides a Chromebook for each student and an Apple Mac for each teacher. This is inconvenient for me when I need to use the Mac computer to project part of a lesson for the students to use while also needing it available for sometimes confidential administrative tasks like taking roll, entering grades and responding to emails. This Chromebit solves my problems. I've plugged it into the HDMI input on the ceiling-mounted LCD projector and I control it with a Logitec USB wireless keyboard/mouse, so now the Mac is mine for teacher-stuff and the Chromebit does the education-projection stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: "Aw SNAP!"  Grrrrrrr!
customer_reviews.text: It set up reasonably well, and the display and the sound were fine. My issue is this: After a few seconds to a few minutes on most sites, WHAM! The screen says "Aw Snap! Something went wrong!" It seems like the Chrome OS isn't updating or figuring out how to operate like a real computer. I use chromebooks regularly, and they don't hiccup every few minutes. I really want this little devil to work, but it's more hassle than it's worth.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Patton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best cable cutter..!! Looking forward to faster processor. It will replace my desktop computer. It worked great for a few weeks. Now it is starting to show effects of overheating. First... the mouse did not work..... later, mouse came back but there was no audio.... Even later yet, audio came back but the wifi signal level was down to 5% of what it was before. It took me awhile to suspect overheating. I cut the power for a few hours until it became cool to touch. I plugged back in. Surprise..!!! It started working like it was new. I am switching off the power when not in use. Now it works perfectly...!! I am giving 3-stars instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Joung R. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t know I’d find a worse update experience than windows, but here it is.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, so plug it in get signed in and of course software out of date... so down load, then it has to restart to finish, ok.... use to that, but get it up again, now in endless white box screen with spinning circle and “please wait”..... and I’m waiting.....20 minutes waiting.....really it’s still going.... definitely worse than window; that’s really bad.... guess I totally wasted my money, and now i’ve got a expensive ChromeBrick.
customer_reviews.author: Agrican

customer_reviews.title: Setup was easy and efficient as it took less than 15 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Anxiously received my Chromebit yesterday. Setup was easy and efficient as it took less than 15 minutes. Setup and first launching is greatly aided if you are already an experienced Chrome OS user as you will know where to look for all of the settings and configuration panes. Pages on the web rendered fairly quickly, with 4 tabs open the experience was very acceptable. I also purchased a Logitech Wireless Touch Keyboard k400 with Built-in Multi-Touch Touchpad ($24.99) to go with the Chromebit which aided navigation tremendously. It looks as if Google and Asus got this right.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hudgins

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't run video conferences
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go at the back of an office TV to run Zoom and WebEx, Chrome kept freezing failing time after time to run all video based apps. I wish I could return it, I guess this will end up in one of the drawers, next to all other useless tech I bought over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: ... and with the Chrome Sign Builder Add-on it works great! We have it running that program that links ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this ChromeBit as a digital sign and with the Chrome Sign Builder Add-on it works great! We have it running that program that links to a google slide show. We can then change the slideshow at anytime which then automatically updates (within a few min.) on the display. With this setup we are planning on more signs off-site.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super value....
customer_reviews.text: Super value... If you know what a Chromebook is, you know what you're getting... OK, its not a Google Pixelbook, but it is a great way to add computer functionality to your TV... If you keep your expectations in check (its only 85 bucks) you will be very satisfied... I use mine with my TV and a Logitec K400 keyboard... Great for streaming video content or just internet browsing...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for cheap setup
customer_reviews.text: This + a spare monitor, hdmi to dvi adaptor, and wireless keyboard was cheapest basic computer setup I could put together for our office. We just use it to display sales stats from the internet on a monitor, it was very easy to setup and gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: B. Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Overheats, locks up and dies
customer_reviews.text: OK for light browsing or shopping but if you try to watch videos or have multiple active tabs it gets very very hot, locks up and dies. have to disconnect power, wait till it cools and reconnect after no more than thirty of video play.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love our Chromebooks and now our 70" TV is one too!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Plugged it into one of the HDMI ports on our big screen TV, added a USB keyboard with touchpad and now our 70" not-Smart-TV is a giant 1080P Chromebook. While it's possible to do everything that you could do with a Chrome browser (surf the net, check email, check in on social media, etc.) we use it mostly to watch full screen videos from Youtube, Vimeo, Hulu, on-line network shows. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Video Andy

customer_reviews.title: Do not get this for a workplace / high use setting.
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use this as a google hangout device for a remote worker. System went haywire in 3 months. I think it's overheated and fried out components. Thought it was the camera, so we replaced it. Then thought it was the usb hub, so replaced that. Finally realized the Chromebit was basically fried. Hangouts crashes (using Chrome Browser) multiple times per day and the camera looks like it's using some art-deco filter if it works at all. Audio began to lag 3-5 seconds as well. Useless for this particular application, do not get this if you're looking specifically for a hangout/camera system that runs for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Uyemura

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Not as fast as a Chromebook and the Wifi is a lot more sensitive. Using a bluetooth keyboard to interface is OK but can be a bit laggy. The USB port for wireless mouse dongle attachment, memory stick, etc is a very good feature. Good enough for browsing, but Youtube streaming isn't as good as the Chromestick. Guess that's the trade-off.....being able to browse vs uninterrupted Youtube. Would recommend this to anyone who lives on web-pages, has a TV and doesn't want the cost of buying a Chromebook as the price/performance point is still in the "plus" area.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: very unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This product works very inconsistently. we have been using it with a smart TV and wireless keyboard, and it regularly goes into sleep mode,stops working during a video, or when searching the internet. it also will often fail to turn back on when going from TV or video imput back to HDMI. we have tried to adjust settings and troubleshoot these problems, but it is very frustrating. the user is a person with limited mobility who is not able to continually get up and unplug and reinsert the device into the TV port, which will sometimes restart the chromebit. overall, this is a very frustrating and unreliable way to convert a tv into a computer screen.
customer_reviews.author: Honey Badger

customer_reviews.title: Because it has a small footprint it is easy to throw a large plastic dust cover over this ...
customer_reviews.text: In use in a dusty pottery for the past 6 months.I watch a lot of Utube vids.This unit performs out of all proportion to its size and price.Attached directly to my asus screen,the other end takes a dongle for the mouse/keyboard.Next to no cords to tangle and does the exact job of a larger Chromebox.Because it has a small footprint it is easy to throw a large plastic dust cover over this setup when I am out of the shop.
customer_reviews.author: John Feesey

customer_reviews.title: however for signage this unit reaches its thermal threshold way too easily. It cannot be left on for extended periods ...
customer_reviews.text: The device is adequate when it comes to minor office work and internet browsing, however for signage this unit reaches its thermal threshold way too easily. It cannot be left on for extended periods of time. Support for google play services has not been delivered as advertised. The operating system and cloud based applications work flawlessly but the fact you cannot use this device for more than an hour or so continually makes it nearly un-usable. I would not recommend this product to anyone other than a child.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I tried a few replacements in vain
customer_reviews.text: Crushes quite often. I returned and tried replacements. Still got frozen or crushed or not even loading webpages in many many instances. I gave up and am using a tablet watching webpages these days without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hahn

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Turns any TV into a part-time computer. Don't expect blazing performance though...
customer_reviews.text: Great! Very happy with this purchase. Turned the 40 inch LCD panel in our living room into a part-time computer display without having to drag a laptop over to it, go through the huge hassle of connecting everything up and disconnecting it all when done-major inconvenience! Mainly used for youtube and some other streaming internet video on that TV and have had no problems with connection quality or video quality. Works great, recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Device is at End of Life as of November 2020
customer_reviews.text: I checked several places & found glowing reviews of this device except that it seemed to run warm (I noticed this but it did not seem excessive.) What I did not know until the device arrived yesterday is that there will be no software updates past November 2020. The 2 Asus customer support people I spoke with were very courteous but indicated that nothing could be done to extend the EOL of this device & they did not have a newer version of this product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Read

customer_reviews.title: boots to unsupported display resolution; no way to change the setting
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to use this with an older 720p TV, and the Chromebit is booting to an unsupported resolution. SInce I can't see the display, there's no way to adjust the resolution. The product is exactly what I was looking for from a feature standpoint, but it is useless if it won't start in a supported display resolution. I should point out that a Chromecast worked fine with this TV, so it's not a display issue. It seems that ASUS failed to implement a decent startup process for this device.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this one. We can use Google chrome on it and of course ad block extension will help us watch movies on YouTube without interruption of ads. Very convenient to carry with us for a vacation. Just plug it in the hotel TV then you can start watching movies online. One other my favorite thing of this one is I can able to install any Android app on it. All Android apps run very smooth. Enjoy !
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: Converts a TV to an electronic bulletin board
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for use on a new flatscreen TV for use in my church's narthex as an electronic bulletin board. Works like a charm. Got a $20 dollar rebate. The rebate company hired by ASUS was not pleasant but after threatening to sue them, they agreed to pay me the $20. So why do you need this even on a smart tv? The browser that comes with even smart TV's is very limited. This little "mini computer" fills in and the TV can pick up our wirless network instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good for on the go
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for someone regularly on the go and in need a portable mini PC however this did not fit my needs as a full-time PC as it had to be separately powered down from the monitor which it was plugged into. This may not seem like a big deal but having two navigate through the power menu to manually power down before accidentally turning the TV or monitor off became a nuisance
customer_reviews.author: wayne parton

customer_reviews.title: These things are great - small form factor and low price
customer_reviews.text: These things are great - small form factor and low price. We use them on 9 different TVs around the office to display reports from a sharepoint site. Work great and low cost - are a bit picky on the Bluetooth keyboards, ended up going with wireless KB/mouse units with USB dongle. This could be an issue if you need USB port for something else as the Chromebit only has one.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Statz

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect As Intended
customer_reviews.text: This browser-on-a-stick does everything ChromeOS can do and does it extremely well. I plugged in my cheap-o wireless keyboard and mouse (not bluetooth) and it worked like a charm. I now have a full computer on my TV. Some nay-sayers complain about functionality. It's $85 and works as extremely well as designed. Very important - make sure not to purchase from some 3rd party on Amazon's site. I've heard of people paying extra, not receiving the device a month later, etc... buyer beware - stick with Amazon/ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Weiner

customer_reviews.title: When it worked it seemed good. Started freezing up
customer_reviews.text: When it worked it seemed good. Started freezing up. Sent it to ASUS after their troubleshooting failed to solve the problem. Waiting to see that happens with the RMA. Got a the devices back from ASUS. No luck. The same problem occurs. The screen freezes after a random amount of time (usually 1-5 minutes). As such it is basically useless. I have an older Panasonic plasma TV I am using it with and this is probably the problem. I don't recommend if you have an older TV as you may have problems like me.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Kline

customer_reviews.title: Lightest weight computer I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Plugged this into a flat screen television, added a USB with multiple outlets to control a wireless keyboard and mouse, and it brought the internet home immediately. Works with any any monitor, any size, any location with accessible HDMI outlet. Chrome Quality at a fraction of the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: The best option if you are getting a PC stick computer.
customer_reviews.text: I originally got an ACEPC computer stick with 4 gigs of ram etc running Windows 10, and it was a crippling experience. Then I got the Chromebit and the moment I plugged it in and turned it on, I was online, OS updated in seconds, and everything runs smooth as butter, including video 1080p. I could not watch video of any sort on the ACEPC and do anything without it stuttering and freezing.
customer_reviews.author: Adontai

customer_reviews.title: Amazing computing power for a stick pc.
customer_reviews.text: This little computer on a stick is amazing. I've never used chrome os before but it is such an easy to use platform. A simple Bluetooth keyboard and it was so easy to use my TV as my new computer.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: This is so cool!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our conference room tv at work. With a simple wireless keyboard we can easily pull up our commercial real estate website [...] to show property to clients. We can easily see google maps, videos, photos, etc. and I found a free/cheap screen saver that works through Chrome/Google photos to cycle through property images and our logo that runs through your the day when the room is empty. I'm amazed that a whole computer is right there in this tiny device.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Great computers for behind a TV
customer_reviews.text: These work really well. We have them secured behind out TVs to run stats for all the sales people in our business. They were very simple to set up and haven't seen any limitations. We paired this up with a small wireless keyboard/mouse combo that we could also secure behind the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up, simple interface
customer_reviews.text: Easy set-up, simple interface, and good performance. The only caveats are a flaky connection to a Logitech mouse (the type with a USB dongle....it works perfectly with an Apple Bluetooth keyboard) and too-small type size on the Chrome UI. In-browser type size is adjustable, though login and settings size is not and is quite small on a 47" TV at a ten foot distance.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent computer.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent computer. No problem setting up on my 60 in LG TV. Color and visual clarity is terrific. If you're in the market for a 2nd computer I would consider this one. Great for streaming You Tube, Netflix, Amazon etc. Anything you can do on a regular size desktop or laptop can be done on this computer. I would recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Esposito

customer_reviews.title: Light browsing but struggles with 1080 video
customer_reviews.text: Good for light browsing on my TV. But the chromebit struggles to output 720 or 1080 video. Plus it will randomly just crash to all the way off and the dongle is hot to the touch. There is no technical support from Asus or Google. You are SOL when, not if you have problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Performance
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me you would want one of these for a simple way to use chrome on your tv without wireless interruption... But with the underpowered processor/ram what you get is a performance-based stuttering mess. It couldn't even handle a Facebook embedded video. Everything became unresponsive and just sitting there for like 10 seconds waiting for the browser to refresh. Immediately I knew this wasn't the product for me.
customer_reviews.author: David Rosen

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a chromebook is a better option.
customer_reviews.text: I was really impressed at first. It handles most of my web browsing tasks with ease. Then it started crashing. So I did a factory reset and removed extensions. Then it crashed again. And again. I tried watching a movie on Google Play Movies tonight and it worked. Until it froze-up a few times. That's when I decided I would return it. Only to find out that my return window ended 2 days ago.
customer_reviews.author: Angry but not Lewis Black angry

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy!  End of Updates is 11/5/20.
customer_reviews.text: Seems fine but end of support and updates is 11/5/20. Not cool! It’s worth maybe $5 to use it for a month.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Walter

customer_reviews.title: IT SUCKS! IN EVERY WAY!
customer_reviews.text: If you aren't buying this just to check your Gmail... DONT BUY IT. It's literally useless outside of standard Google apps like "docs" or "slides" it is not for digital signage or remote use no matter how Google trys to tell you thats what its for. I mean you literally can't use the chrome remote desktop on a chromebit, I guess they decided you wouldn't need it. Please just buy something else and don't waist your time and money like I did😓
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Sherrill

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Chrome OS PC that disappears to the back of your TV or monitor
customer_reviews.text: An easy to setup mini PC that will cover at least 90% of your requirements. Built in 802.11ac WiFi and Bluetooth 4.0 ensures that you will be able to connect to just about any wireless point and accessory. Ideal for setting up a unit for guest access or if you want to use this in a kiosk. Only gripe is that it has just one USB port, but it's really not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Sharat Faqurudheen

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY UNTIL YOU CHECK THE END OF USE DATE
customer_reviews.text: The product is fine, bought it in January not knowing there is an end of use date in November.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while but now its dead
customer_reviews.text: The Chromebit worked great for about 6 months, then all of the sudden it just died. Now it will not boot up unless I attempt to unplug/re-plug it multiple times. It MAY reboot, but once it goes to sleep, it dies again. It sounded great and we liked it while it worked but now it's a brick. Don't buy this until they work out the bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So awesome for $85...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what it does, but needs a little more memory I think, or it might be something else. I also have a Chromebox with a memory upgrade (double the memory of the Chromebit), and the Chromebox video is consistently smoother for HD streaming than the Chromebit. That said, it's a very minor complaint, and I'm extremely happy with the Chromebit for the price. If I had more than two TVs, I'd buy more of these. If these were out a year earlier, I wouldn't have bought the Chromebox and would have bought another of these instead.
customer_reviews.author: Re-Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to use. My company uses Google Apps Suite for email, calendar, and drive. I can access all of the business administration activities from this, plus I can remotely log into another machine if I need more processing power. It would have been nice if the device could be powered off USB, but I guess it requires more power than something like a Chromecast.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Antilla

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Quick setup
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Quick setup. My main goal was to be able to stream Xfinity on my 65 inch Samsung. USing Chrome browser I am able to watch Xfinity. No problem. The Bad news is that DirecTV Now doesn't not work with chrome. All in all a good way to stream and have a computer on your TV.
customer_reviews.author: RMigs

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, but pretty darn close.
customer_reviews.text: This works for so many use cases. The only thing I wish it had was the play store for additional applications. I'd love to use this for my Shadow PC on my T.V. Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: ZMMT

customer_reviews.title: Nice little gadget
customer_reviews.text: It is at its end of life for OS and security updates. It's still very usable, and perfect for what I need it for. Would have given it five stars if it wasn't for it being at end of life.
customer_reviews.author: Brad VanVleet

customer_reviews.title: Great Produce but expired updates.
customer_reviews.text: I really like Chromebit and just got this as my second one. Unfortunately, it will not update past Chrome OS version 72 since it is beyond it's 3 1/2 year update cycle. The current update as of today is 85. I needed at least 75 to load Xfinity Stream. If it weren't for the update issue I'd give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: ACK

customer_reviews.title: Put is on any screen tv or monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is the best HDM computer in the world plus the price is good deal too. Chromebit is the best portable device out there & it works great. If anyone is looking for a desktop this is the way to go but you have to get your own set up look the computer monitor, keyboard with mouse & speakers it's a good deal. I enjoy using this device in my very day life.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it as an upgrade for the TV I used to have a "chromecast" attached to. This definitely fits the bill: I can browse the web and view streaming content no problem. You can also do anything you could with a regular chromebook computer, but my own use is limited for now. It is WAY better IMHO than the alternative of putting a low-end desktop PC near the TV and connecting them.
customer_reviews.author: Glen S

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: The video playback is very choppy and annoying. Google play is not available with this device. Wish I would have done more research first. I will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Oklahoma28

customer_reviews.title: Love the ChromeBit
customer_reviews.text: I love my Chromebit. Have used it for about a week and it does everything i wanted. I have a vizio smart tv (VIA app based) and wanted to add an internet browser to be able to watch TV shows from the network sites. Works for all i have tried but ABC.Com shows(they do not support ChromeOS). Streams very well. Do wish it doubled as a ChromeCast.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: amazing device
customer_reviews.text: i am going to buy more, love this device. Turn any TV into a computer, digital signage, casting, slide shows. I love this thing. Well worth $85.
customer_reviews.author: Cedar23

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck!!
customer_reviews.text: Chromebit rocks. Set up in ten minutes and everything is just like on your other ChromeOS machines. No sysadmin. No upgrade hassles or having to worry about virus and malware protection. Least expensive desktop you can buy!
customer_reviews.author: robert mudry

customer_reviews.title: This little thing is awesome I bought it to do my paperwork on my ...
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is awesome I bought it to do my paperwork on my TV quickbooks online loaded right up on it I can invoice and print my accounts recavaible
customer_reviews.author: Eric moree

customer_reviews.title: Works great. It’s annoying that it won’t work without a ...
customer_reviews.text: Set this up for a friend who only needs e-mail and a browser. Works great. It’s annoying that it won’t work without a Google account. Sometimes it won’t wake up from sleep unless the USB keyboard is disconnected and reconnected.
customer_reviews.author: W. Hohauser

customer_reviews.title: a great product. You plug it into the hdmi port ...
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes, maybe once in two weeks, it locks up and the power cord has to be disconnected/reconnected. Otherwise, a great product. You plug it into the hdmi port on your TV and a power outlet, connect a wireless keyboard [i use Logitech K830 illuminated rechargeable keyboard], and you have a Chrome browser. It can play live TV streams, which is what I got this for.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Zoolander
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 3 to replace a tower computer and added 2 wall mounted TV's to our business walls. We hired a programmer to make custom WordPress wall art and advertising space that we uploaded with no problem. It's great to have a small computer that we can tuck up behind the TV's out of sight. Never heard of them before my tech guy pointed me in this direction and was surprised how small they were when they arrived. (The files are in the computer?)
customer_reviews.author: No Skillz Millz

customer_reviews.title: Anything with a HDMI port is a Chrome device.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a few of these - super easy to use, and a great way to do signage and presentations if you need to, or just use on your home tv and make a dumb device a smart one!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Sims

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for what it is
customer_reviews.text: It's an inexpensive chrome-stick that does give you a way to serve the web on your tv or monitor without spending 100's of dollars on Chromebook or Chromebox
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When paired with a webcam, input audio includes static unless the video is disabled
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use as a dedicated Google Hangouts device with awith a powered USB hub. Video works great, but input audio comes through with static. If the video is disabled, the input audio static goes away. Unfortunately if this can't be fixed, the device will need to be re-purposed or returned. Side note: A powered USB hub is highly recommended if you're plugging in more than one device, like this one:
customer_reviews.author: PolicyStat

customer_reviews.title: Turns your TV into a Chromebox
customer_reviews.text: My concern about using the Chromebit was that, using WiFi it may not keep up with HD video streaming. But it has not stuttered once. It is by far the best computer for bringing the internet to your home theater. You do need to get wireless keyboard/mouse or trackpad. I use a combo keyboard trackpad from Logitech. The wireless USB fob fits right in the end of it.
customer_reviews.author: gallen

customer_reviews.title: A NEW SALES TOOL FOR GOOGLE
customer_reviews.text: NOT AS ADVERTISED I THOUGHT I COULD LOAD MY VIDEOS AND STILLS...NO WAY IT IS CLOSED ENDING SYSTREM TO BENEFIT GOOGLE NOT US
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this last November and it worked great for a few months but then it periodically started ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this last November and it worked great for a few months but then it periodically started to glitch. The last couple of weeks the device would work every other day or so. When it did work, the volume would be permanently set to it's lowest setting, even when I manually reset the device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for many niche purposes
customer_reviews.text: Very useful as a travel computer. Just plug into large HDMI TV in hotel room, and you have a usable desktop. But I needed a wired mouse in order to pair my bluetooth keyboard and mouse. Maybe there are bluetoon mice that can paid automarically, but my Logitech M535 could not. Fine for email, youtube, and web browsing. Occasionally a bit sluggish, but totally usable considering price.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert Longfellow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for cloud-based work
customer_reviews.text: This is a remarkable value for the price, as it is a fully operational personal computer. Excellent for cloud-based work, like Gmail, Google Docs, Office 365, etc. Plays Netflix, Hulu, HBO, etc. just fine on a large HDTV screen. It has some trouble with smaller Flash-powered streaming TV sites. e.g. NBC's and Fox's online streaming sites, though I'm not sure how much to blame the device as opposed to those sites.
customer_reviews.author: David Hazlehurst

customer_reviews.title: This little thing is fantastic, great for conference roooms
customer_reviews.text: This thing is perfect for work when you don't want to bother with other, more expensive set ups. Looks more professional than chromecasting, cheaper than using a chromebox or full-blown PC setup in a conference room or similar setting. It won't set speed records, but is certainly snappy enough to get the job done well (I've used it for web-based presentations, slideshows, power point presentations, etc.). If I needed another, I wouldn't hesitate a minute to buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Sabado

customer_reviews.title: Strong recommended product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and worth for money. Easy to install and setup, able to connect to my speakers via Bluetooth feature. Strong recommended product.
customer_reviews.author: Son Le

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool little gadget
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough. Just remember that it will be formatted as a computer on your TV screen so text will most likely be petty small (computer screens are meant to be viewed yo close). You may want to adjust that or zoom in. Also, the processor isn't great, so some higher bandwidth streaming (watch ESPN) will be kinda choppy. That's why 4 stars not 5.
customer_reviews.author: Carson A.

customer_reviews.title: Has just enough CPU and RAM to not bog down on complex sites
customer_reviews.text: This is quite a cool device. We use it for digital signage where we display some websites in full screen. It works great and has just enough ram and CPU to not bog down browsing complex web sites. I could see someone using this as a computer too.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Grandma-friendly
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly capable little product. Was considering getting a Raspberry Pi to run a kiosk, but this thing has the horsepower to run video in the browser. Pretty much everything is a web app these days anyway. Easy to get running, easy to reset, all your settings are just there when you login. More like an appliance than a computer, and I really like that.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Great for basic and surfing and banking
customer_reviews.text: Great for basic surfing performance is good but not as good as an Intel based chrome book, the Bluetooth and mouse I use Microsoft, the sculpt , they lag, I tested a wireless Logitech combo and it improved. Would have bean better if it had usb plug for power to plug directly to the tv just like the chromecast but it draws more power it gets really hot to the touch.
customer_reviews.author: J.A

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: At first I must say, I recieved a second hand unit from Amazon of which the serial no's did not even match on the box. The unit did not even boot up! Returned it and recieved my new one. Apart from this bad experience the product it self is great. Works as described. Boots in seconds, very user friendly. Perfect for the individual that mostly want to use google, drive, you tube and surfing on TV. The Logitech Wireless keyboard is a must to get with this, makes life so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Roaan Barkhuizen

customer_reviews.title: support ends Nov 2020
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these in Jan 2019 and when I went to use today, I found out that support ends on Nov 2020. VERY UNHAPPY ABOUT THIS.
customer_reviews.author: bobbie

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for internet video.
customer_reviews.text: Slightly disappointed, as it does seem to be slower than my older chromebook for video streaming tasks. I get regular very short audio dropouts that are annoying. This seems like a natural for streaming video use, but it just doesn't seem to be up to the task. And it would not connect to my regular wireless network, no matter what I did. I had to set up a separate guest network just for this device.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Keaton

customer_reviews.title: Chrome OS for school homework -  connect to TV and way you go!
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive solution for 4th grader to complete homework assignment. I paired it with Logitech K400 Plus Wireless Touch TV Keyboard works together like a charm with Samsung 32" TV as dual purpose. I love it how practical it is! Highly recommend parents on budget to get similar hook up!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Prok

customer_reviews.title: It does not work
customer_reviews.text: This device does not connect to the internet so it's completely useless. It connects to the WiFi router, obtains an IP address and other dhcp settings, but it does not load any resource neither from the internet nor from local IPs, though that device reports that WiFi signal is strong. Asus web site has only FAQ for troubles with WiFi, but the device connects to WiFi. There's no info for this specific problem.
customer_reviews.author: vadzim

customer_reviews.title: Cool Chrome computer stick
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Haven’t used tech support but don’t see a need to with this product. Plug and play. About as useful as my Chromebook. I used a usb hub to expand its use and it works. It recognizes my keyboard, mouse and various usb drives. Pretty good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: DeWyggeley

customer_reviews.title: DONT EXPECT INTERNET VIDEO STREAMING  SOUND  PICTURE  WAY OUT OF SINK
customer_reviews.text: CHROME OS OK WAS GOING TO USE AS VIDEO STREAMER ....TERIBLE MY 16 YEAR OLD WD TV WAY BETTER ONLY GOOD FOR WEB BRUSING VERY BASIC
customer_reviews.author: scott s

customer_reviews.title: Only good for short browsing sessions
customer_reviews.text: The Chromebit works the best only when used for quick browsing sessions. But performs extremely slow when streaming videos. Connected my bluetooth mouse and keyboard which made things even worse. The mouse rendering has become tougher than maneuvering a car in the toughest roads. Using(useless) keyboard takes a special skill because one keystroke is taken multiple times and one backspace would clear the entire sentence. Now I need to buy a raspberry pie instead of this.
customer_reviews.author: Ravi

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Goodbye Windows! For anyone who just surfs and watches youtube, this product is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: Pigroast

customer_reviews.title: Great for digital signage in office
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my office to run some websites that have our numbers of visits for the day. They work great and rarely need any intervention from me. I have them setup through my google administration site and have pushed a kiosk app to them that launches as soon as the device gets power.
customer_reviews.author: Andy H

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool chrome
customer_reviews.text: This chromebit is clutter free. It is the equivalent of the chromebook or chromebox on a stick. 2 improvements i would recommend are: 1 - add headphone jack. I use these for school and don't have Bluetooth headphones. 2 - add a startup botton. I have to unplug and plug in to start.
customer_reviews.author: N. V.

customer_reviews.title: Good-by Windows
customer_reviews.text: For my computer needs this is the best computer I've ever owned. I already had a monitor and USB mouse and keyboard so this was about as frugal as it gets. I did have to add a USB splitter for photos from my camera and cell phone. I guess I could have splurged for a Chromebox but this set-up is everything that I need. There were a couple of very minor things that I had to figure out in my move from Windows but nothing a little Googling didn't quickly resolve.
customer_reviews.author: M. McCracken

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Connected to mini mobile keyboard/trackpad combo. Support to end this November :-(
customer_reviews.author: John Wesley Hester

customer_reviews.title: it is perfect. But I didn't expect 1-usb slot would be ...
customer_reviews.text: As a device, it is perfect. But I didn't expect 1-usb slot would be a problem. When I need to connect a flash memory ,my phone or anything, I have to use a bluetooth keyboard which works in a short range. About the operating system, I can't use to chrome. It is different, depends on the internet 100%. It just for surfing and watching. It starts very fast. As opening a file :), I like that.
customer_reviews.author: Moath

customer_reviews.title: only for the basics
customer_reviews.text: Only suitable for the most basic computing tasks. After three or four tabs, the browser runs out of memory
customer_reviews.author: Akshun J

customer_reviews.title: Good, but ESPN Streaming Issues.
customer_reviews.text: Great for an HTPC, but doesn't stream espn well. A tick slow when multiple tabs are open. But pretty good overall, would be great if espn would stream. But got to use Apple TV for ESPN. I like this more than Apple TV since you get the internet, but still need Win 7 for the best HTPC.
customer_reviews.author: Cable Free Since 2003

product_meta.title: ASUS Chromebit CS10 Stick-Desktop PC with RockChip 3288-C 2 GB LPDDR3L 16 GB EMMC Google Chrome OS
product_meta.description:
Color:BLACKASUS Chromebit - simpler and smarter, Chrome OS on a stick

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Smallest chrome OS device, turn any HDMI display into a computer and 100 GB Google drive space
Dual band a/b/g/n/ac 802.11 wi fi with bluetooth 4.0 for fast connections and wireless peripheral compatibility
16 gb flash memory storage with easily accessible USB 2.0 slot for expanded storage or wired peripherals
Included HDMI extender cable and 4 hook and loop stickers allow for more options in setting up chromebit
Thousands of chrome os apps allows for work and play in a portable package; Power supply: 18 w power adapter

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars850 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
